p: In addition to the photoprotective properties, the topical application of oils decreases the trauma during dressing replacement, prevents dehydration of the wounded tissue, and functions as a barrier against microorganism invasion into the temporally unprotected tissue [ 58]. Based on the results of in vitro assays, RPLO does not exert antimicrobial effects on the evaluated bacteria. The absence of direct antimicrobial actions was also described for the oil extracted from the snake Spilotes pullatus (Linnaeus, 1758) [ 59], in contrast to the oil extracted from the Brazilian boa Boa constrictor Linnaeus, 1758, [ 60]. Thus, further studies of the antimicrobial properties of oils are encouraged.
